Answer: How far behind are we, the consumers, in terms of the technology made available to us?3–5 years.Not because of some nefarious plot to keep consumers back, but because technology exists that isn’t viable as a consumer product. It needs to economies of scale to bring the costs down, sometimes the sources of the materials needed don’t exist, and sometimes there simply isn’t a market for it until someone big gets behind it. You can see this all the time when people whine when Apple introduces something that other people did it first, but it wasn’t a mass market product until Apple did it.GenerallyHow far behind are we, the consumers, in terms of the technology made available to us?3–5 years.Not because of some nefarious plot to keep consumers back, but because technology exists that isn’t viable as a consumer product. It needs to economies of scale to bring the costs down, sometimes the sources of the materials needed don’t exist, and sometimes there simply isn’t a market for it until someone big gets behind it. You can see this all the time when people whine when Apple introduces something that other people did it first, but it wasn’t a mass market product until Apple did it.Generally speaking, 3–5 years though is what it takes as long as it’s possible and there is a market for it.
